lines.text: What ho! Bring me my royal pipe. And step on it.

[to the TV audience]
At this point, you might think we'd go for the cheap joke. But we're not going to.
Sally, you've never seen a street like Sesame Street before. Everything happens here. You're gonna love it!
Never refer to me as an item. I'm a bird.
Super. Duper. Flooper.
Hooper. Hooper.

[angrily]
Do you think you can bring me a meal *without* dropping it on the floor?
Where there is life, there is hope.
Say! Aren't you Johnny Trash?
No, Cash.
Cash, Cash!
Yeah. Have a rotten day!
Hello everybodeeeeeeeee! It is I, Grover!

[in Grover's taxi]
I do not want to go to the museum, I do not want to go the movies, I do not want to go to the zoo! I want YOU to drive ME to the library!
Gladly, sir. If you do not mind waiting.
Waiting? Waiting for what?
'Til I get my car fixed. It is broken.
I can't wait 'til your car is fixed. I'm in a hurry!
Oh alright, sir, if you are going to be difficult.
[calls out]
Hey, Herry! Forget the gargage. We need to go to the library!
But I'm in a hurry. Hey...?
Well in that case I shall call you a taxi.
[calls out]
Taxi! Taxi, we got a library job! Taxi! They never stop when you need them. Have you ever noticed that?
Hamlet, by William Shakespeare. It no get classier than this.
[Repeated line]

[before eating cookies]
Cowabunga!

[Introducing Bert's play about taking care of one's teeth]
Hello everyone, boys and girls. I want to welcome you and thank you for coming to see today's show. Today's show was written entirely by Bert, and was directed by Bert, and stars none other then our old friend Bert. If the play was just wonderful, you can thank Bert, but if the play was horrible, you have no one but Bert to blame.

[after appearing from behind the curtain]
Prairie, will you stop that? Just go to the piano and start the play!

[quieter]
The stage manager is also Bert.
What's that, Bert?
I couldn't hear you, Bert.

[Yelling]
10Q, 10Q, 10Q!
You're welcome, you're welcome, you're welcome, Bert.
[laughs]
At last! Now you see him and you got to believe me. He's not imaginary after all. I told you all along there was a Snuffleupagus, my best pal. I told you, but you never believed me.
Wait a minute, Big Bird. Maria, Linda and I believed you.
Yeah, but no one else did.
That's right, Big Bird. We didn't, but...
But what?
Yeah, but what?
Big Bird, you have a right to be angry.
I do?
Sure, I mean after all this time, and we never believed you. That must have been very hard on you.
Well, yeah.
I'll tell you what, Big Bird. From now on, we'll believe you whenever you tell us something.
You promise?
We promise.
We might want to get that in writing.

[Bert has reluctantly agreed to have Ernie give him a haircut... ]
Ernie. I'm bald.
Um... well, I wouldn't say that, Bert.
You wouldn't say that?
[explodes]
No, but it's true!
Well, I know it's true, I just wouldn't say it, Bert.

[hysterical]
You cut all my hair off!
Yes, well, I 'm sorry about that...
Ernie!
But, but it will grow back again, you know...
My hair!
It'll take a *month* for it to grow back, Ernie!

[plaintively]
A whole month?
A whole month! What are you gonna do about it?
Uh... Bert! I have just the thing for you. Just a second.
[ducks off screen]
Oh, my hair.

[reappears carrying a large book]
Here you go, Bert.
What is that, a book?
Mm-hmm.
[places it on the ledge in front of them]
A book won't make my hair grow faster.
No, but it'll give you something to do while you're waiting.
[snickers and runs off screen]
Errnieee!
You know, whenever I'm not sleepy, Bert tells me to count sheep?
"Count Sheep?" Who's that?
Uh, uh, it's not a who, it's a what.
Hello, sir, and welcome to Grover's Taxi.
Oh no, it's you!
Yes it is I, your furry blue taxi driver. What can I do for you, sir?
I want to go to the library.
Oh a very wise choice. The library is a wonderful place with books to read and you can listen to records like "The Air is Alive with the Sound of Music."
I know that. Let's go.
You know you can take home books from the library too, if you bring them back of course.
I know. That's why I'm going there.
Of course you could also go to the zoo.
I don't want to go to the zoo!
Why? There are lions and tigers there. And the lions go Rrrrroar! And do not forget the monkeys, they are so cute, they go "Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh!" And you can buy a balloon there.
I don't wanna hear "Ooh ooh ooh ooh ooh!" I don't want a balloon, I want to go to the library!
[repeated line]
I don't get it.
[repeated line]
It's not fair. It's just not fair!
Oh, I love pigeons more then anything else in this world... besides oatmeal.

[repeated Line]
I forgot!
[repeated question]
Why me?
[Oscar the Grouch's famous last line]
Now leave me alone and get lost!
[Another of Oscar the Grouch's famous lines/catchphrases]
Scram!
Oh look, it's Mr. Noodle's brother, Mr. Noodle.
How about the museum? You can look at pictures of the mummies... And the daddies.
I don't want to look at pictures of the mummies and the daddies!
Cookie Monster thief, not liar.

[after reading Trash Gordon]
Read more! Read more!
Uh uh. Sorry, Slimy, time for sleep now. So close your eyes and dream of all the wonderful Trash that's yet to come.
[to the camera]
You too. There'll be more Trash tomorrow.
Read! Read! Read!
Okay, Slimy, although I do enjoy your pestering.

[Referring to Slimy's book The Adventures of Trash Gordon]
He loves reading Trash.

[after reading Trash Gordon]
More! More! More!
No, no more, Slimey. That was alot of excitement for a little worm. You get some rest and we'll read some more tomorrow.
[to the camera]
You're still here? Hey, why don't you go read a book or something?
[Grover is doing an exercise video]
Jane Fonda, eat your heart out!

[trying to come up with rhyming song lyrics]
Here, try this. Mary had a little canary. It was bluer than the sky. And every where that Mary went, the canary was sure to fly.

[shouts]
But canaries aren't blue!
Jeesh!
I'll never get it! Never! You won't help! Oh!
[bangs his head against the piano]
Uh, you'll hurt yourself in the head, there, Don.

[Oscar has just broken his arm in an accident during a mud road race in his can. He comes up cradling his arm, and one of the humans there suggested taking him to the hospital]
Hospital? You want to take me to the hospital? With all those clean white sheets, and those nice clean nurses and doctors?
[Pounds his hurt arm on the side of the can in frustration, yelling]
I don't want to go... Ow! Ow! Ow!
[Stops and cradles the arm again. Quietly, beat]
Take me to the hospital.
[as Super Grover]
Yes, it is I, *Sup*-er Grover! Protector of small children and bunny rabbits!

[Ernie is having Bert's head traced on the screen, unbeknownst to Bert who can't move and doesn't understand why]
Okay, here is Bert's eye.
[His left eye is traced]
And here is Bert's other eye.
[His other eye is traced]
And the eyes are what you see with, right Bert?
[Bert starts to say something, but is cut off immediately by Ernie]
Don't say anything, Bert.

[singing]
ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ. It's the most remarkable word I've ever seen. ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ. I wish I knew exactly what I mean. It starts out like an A word, as anyone can see. But somewhere in the middle, it gets awful "QR" to me. ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ. If I ever find out just what this word can mean, I'll be the smartest bird the world has ever seen.
[repeated line]
Greetings! I am the Count. They call me the Count because I love to count things.
[repeated line]
Ding-dong! You're wrong!

[as the gang is visiting Puerto Rico, Oscar is walking around asking various different natives one specific question, and appears not to be getting anywhere with it. He comes across Maria with a group of kids and adults, and asks her]
Maria, could you tell me how to say 'no' in Spanish?
No.

[Yelling in desperation]
Can't anybody tell me how to say 'no' in Spanish?

[Loud enough to scare him into hiding]
NO!

[Calmly as he reappears]
Oscar, the way you say 'no' in Spanish is 'no'.
[repeated line]
Hi-ho, Kermit the Frog here at Sesame Street News...
[repeated lines]

[out in the distance]
He-e-e-e-e-ey, froggy baby!
Oh, no.
[Grover walks to Kermit and slaps his back really hard]
Oof!
Come along my darlings. Hello, Mr. Handford.
Hello, Mrs. Snuffleupagus.
Hello, Mr. Handford.
Hello, Snuffy.
Hi, Mr. Hand Foot.
[giggles]
Hi, Alice.
[to the camera]
Boy, now that's a lot of snuffleupaguses.
What a dream! Oh, Very sad!
[as he was going to eat a cookie]
. OH! NO, NO, NO, NO! Never eat cookies again. NO! From now on, Me eat carrots. Yeah!
[Eats carrots]
, And fish
[Eats fish]
, And whole wheat bread
[Eats bread]
, And NO! NO! Cookies! Sorry, Cookie. Me cannot eat you ever... Say you talking, Cookie?... You crying, Cookie?... Hmmm
[Eats the cookie]
Well, Maybe sometime a cookie.
Are you ready to play our game, Count?
Oh, Yes. Sure thing, Pat.
What is your guess and how many pig squeals do you think it will be?
Uh, One squeal, No make it two squeals, No wait, three squeals, No four squeals for five squeals.
Uh, Count. We can only take one guess.
One guess, Two guesses, THREE!
THREE! Is three your guess? Okay, That's your guess. Three pig squeals so give the pig a spin on that turntable.
KEEP YOUR HANDS OFF, PAL!

[Shocks and surprised]
Uh, Uh, Cookie Talked!
Me not cookie, Me monster.
Why, me too. Me, Cookie Monster.
Me, Monster Cookie.

[trying to come up with a rhyming song lyrics]
Mary had a bicycle. It was painted red as fire. And whenever Mary wanted to take a ride, The bicycle had a flat tire.
I like it!
[shouting for joy]
I LIKE IT! Oh, that's great! You have the biggest talent of writing songs. This could be my biggest hit. Would you like to hear it?
Certainly, I would be an honor.
Okay, Fine.

[to the viewers]
Ladies and Gentlemen, Live and in person, Here is Don Music doing his new hit song!
"Miami Mice!"
Yeah, There are pal trees out there. What? What's on the palm tree? What's on? Oh, I am on. Oh, I am on. Oh, Cue the music!
[Miami Mice theme plays]

Hi-ho, This is Kermit the Frog, Speaking to you from the sunny tropics of Miami Florida. And who knows the subject of an adventure, Than the world's famous Miami Mice. And here they are right now, Here is Miami Mice J.P.
Oh, What's Happening?
...Tito!
Que tal, Man!
Today, We are going to talk to you about adventures.
Say what, Frog?
An adventure, Where something exciting happens here!
Adventures? Nah, We got none of that here.
Well, I wish we can help you out, Frog.
But you are the world's famous Miami Mice.
We interrupt this presentation to bring you "A message from your local chicken!"
Hey, Zelda! You're on!
[Clucking]

[Translating]
For those of you who don't speak chicken, Zelda says that she is mighty proud to be a chicken!
[Clucking]

[Translating]
She is proud because chickens lay eggs,
[Clucking]

[Translating]
And eggs are good for you.
[Clucking]

[Translating]
She is also proud that she is covered with feathers that keeps him warn in the winter and hoot in the...
[Clucking]

[Translating]
... in the summer.
[Clucking]

[Translating]
She is also very proud that she can...
[Clucking]

[Translating]
Can cluck!
[Clucking]

[Translating]
Just remember, Folks! Dogs bark, Cats meow. Ducks quack, and Cows moo! But only a chicken can cluck.
[Cluck-Cluck]
You're Welcome, Zelda!
This announcement is sponsored by "The Proud to Be a Chicken Association"!
Oh boy, A bakery shop. Donuts, Cake, Cookies, Etc... I love this place.
Oh, Hello, Sir!
Wait a minute, I know you! You are that waiter from over at Charlie's!
Yes, I have many jobs over the years.
Alright, I want to make this very simple and not make any trobule, I would to buy a...

[as he interrupts Mr. Johnson's sentence]
Excuse me, Sir! Sorry to interrupt you, But I must ask you to please take a number.
But I am the only one in here!
I am sorry, Sir. But that is our policy. The sign says John's Bakery, Not Grover's Bakery. I only work here.
Alright, I'll take a number.
Now, The machine will give you number. And when I call the number, You will be served, So go ahead!
[as Mr. Johnson pulls the lever of the number machine, It came out a sheet of the number]
Very good. And what's your number?
Forty!
Forty! And that's your number!
We interrupt this presentation to bring you "A message from your local chicken!"
Hey, Zelda! You're on!
[Clucking]

[Translating]
For those of you who don't speak chicken, Zelda says that she is mighty proud to be a chicken!
[Clucking]

[Translating]
She is proud because chickens lay eggs,
[Clucking]

[Translating]
And eggs are good for you.
[Clucking]

[Translating]
She is also proud that she is covered with feathers that keeps him warn in the winter and hoot in the...
[Clucking]

[Translating]
... in the summer.
[Clucking]

[Translating]
She is also very proud that she can...
[Clucking]

[Translating]
Can cluck!
[Clucking]

[Translating]
Just remember, Folks! Dogs bark, Cats meow. Ducks quack, and Cows moo! But only a chicken can cluck.
[Cluck-Cluck]
You're Welcome, Zelda!
This announcement is sponsored by "The Proud to Be a Chicken Association"!
Does anybody know what the of that shape is?
Yes, Of course, Guy. It's a...
[Buzzes in]
Yes, Carl?
Is it a circle?
[Buzzer Sounds]
Oh! No!
Oh, I'm sorry, Carl! But that's the wrong answer!
Don't you get it, Carl. The answer is always the same!
Maybe we can invite Alex's father to visit us.
And we can built our toy cars together
I don't think so.
But why not?
Because, He is not around to do it
[He left]
Did we do something wrong?
I don't know. Maybe we will find out.
[They all followed to Alex]
Hello, Alex. We are your friends, You can talk about everything you can.
I know that. But talking about my father makes me very upset.
Did your father move away?
Did he go on vacation?
No, But where he is at, I don't want to talk about it.
What happened to your father?
My father is in jail!

[Shocked]
in jail! But why?
I don't understand this situation.
Actually, I know what you are going through. When I was your age, My father was incarceration too?
He was?
Yes!
Your father was incarceration?
What is incarceration? And why was your father in it?
Incarceration is when someone breaks the law, A grown up rule. And then they have to go to jail or prison.
What are you guys doing?
We are drawing about the house we live in.
Cool, Le me see it.
[Looks at Rosita's house]
Wow!
That is my Casa! And this is my mother!
And this is my apartment where I live on.
That's cool, And what do you got here, Abby?
Well, This is my house, And this is my other house.

[Confused]
Hey, Wait a minute. What do Abby mean her other house?
Well, This is my mother's house, And this is my father's house?
But don't they live together?
Why don't they live together?
Well, My parents are divorced!
Wait, What is a divorce?
Well, A divorce means that her parents are not married anymore.
Why not?
Well, They tried and tried. And they couldn't do it so long. And it sometimes doesn't work.
Did I say Three?
Yes!
I SAID THREE
[HA-HA-HA!]
That's right. Three squeals, Count Von Count. YOU WON!
Oh, I won!
What? He won? Oh no!

And now, It's time to pick a prize from the studio filled with fabulous prizes and to show them to us is our Co-hostess, Velma Blank. A fifteen gallon tank of finger paint, A hand crafted grapefruit goggle for the protection of that morning squirt, And the larger than life portrait of America's 2nd favorite game show host, Pat Playjacks.
It's Didi O-Dey, and The Dew Drops in ''Be My D!''

[singing]
In, In, In, For mooooooooore! In, In, In...

[Interrupts Frazzle dancing]
Hey, Hey! Hold on, Sonny. Well, There is no more! We are closing now. Watch you step.
Well, I guess it's
[singing]
Out, Out, Out, The doooooooor! Out, Out, Out, The doooooooooor!...
Oooooh, I very sorry, Prairie. You guessed ten and there were only five squeals in today's pig, I mean "Squeal of Fortune". That's too bad.
Oh dear. I guess I didn't win. I don't believe this!
Nope, You are close. But you all guessed wrong! This person is a television game show host, and his name is Sonny Friendly.

[laughs]
Hey, Are we having a nice day or what?
WHAT?
And how about that panel? Are they good sport or what, audience?
Well, This is Guy Smiley saying...
YEAH, LET'S HEAR IT FOR GUY, SHALL WE? He is a wonder guess.

[Angrily]
I AM NOT THE GUEST! I AM THE HOST OF THIS SHOW!
This is Sonny Friendly saying...
YOU ARE NOT SAYING IT, I AM SAYING IT.
But I
NO YOU WON'T...
[to a crew member]
THIS WHOLE THING WAS A ROTTEN IDEA! Who put this man on the show?
Guy Smiley's Wardrobe is by Sierra Lagoob. Sonny Friendly's Wardrobe is by Jeff Fredrick.
The contestant who cries the hardest will win an official Sonny Friendly Teddy Bear
[Shows the teddy bear that has Sonny Friendly's hair and teeth]
Wait, THAT'S THE GRAND PRIZE!
Yes, And I believe Ida Nomer cried the hardest and is the winner.
Oh for joy...
But, But
[Runs into the camera]
I LOVE MY TEDDY BEAR, YOU CAN'T DO THAT!
[Sobs loudly]
Sonny Friendly, You cried even harder than Ida Nomer, You won the grand prize!
[Fanfare plays]
WHAT! I WON? Ah, For joys. This is the happiest day of the life. Now, Let's give some consolation prize for our runner's up.
Sorry, There is no consolation prize.
WHAT? No consolation prizes?
[Voice breaks down]
This is awful.

[Sobbing]
IT'S NOT FAIR!

[Voice breaksdown]
This is so, sad!

[while holding his Teddy Bear and leaving the poor contestants sobbing in failure as he holds]
Well, I guess we all can't be winners, huh?
[laughs]

[to the audience]
Well, This is Sonny Friendly saying we will see you again next on ''The Crying Game Show''
[to the Teddy Bear]
Oh, Teddy, I am so glad to have you back.
[Kisses his teddy bear]
Are you glad to see me again?
[to the audience]
Thank you, Audience. You were a great crowd.
